channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023121002
item.description:
Report X-2023121002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal paint cans and two metal jerrycans. All four were separated with fiberboard dividers, inside of plastic bags with positive closure rings and absorbent material in the bottom of the fiberboard box. the lid of one of the paint cans came open and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120545
item.description:
Report X-2023120545

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office as on odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent noticed that wo of the four paint cans inside had spilled their contents. The cans were packaged in plastic bags with absorbent pads inside of a larger plastic bag. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120803
item.description:
Report X-2023120803

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles inside packaged with an egg crate top and bottom. One of the glass bottles had a damaged cap causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at the SWAK table wet from leaking Reagent Alcohol bottle. DescribePack: Failure occurred at the top of the content where there is a small puncture spot under the lid area DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in a spill kit and taken to QA to isolate and await processing

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. PLACED INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVAUATION DescribePack: PKG FOUND WET. CONTENT CAP WAS LOOSE AND PUNCTURED NEAR CAP WHICH CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UPRIGHT AND CAP TIGHTENED

item.title: Report X-2023120812
item.description:
Report X-2023120812

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA discovered package in unload wet and took immediate action to mitigate the situation. Package was instantly placed into an appropriate spill tote and taken to be examined. DescribePack: Three of the 1-gallon containers of isopropyl alcohol had loose caps. The seal under the caps had also been torn allowing the contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA followed proper hazmat handling procedures to get the package out of unload without further release.

item.title: Report X-2023120869
item.description:
Report X-2023120869

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The wet package was removed from sort, placed in a tote with an absorbent pad, and brought to the HMPA for processing. DescribePack: The four bottles in the shipment all leaked from their caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spillage was largely confined to the carton and tote. An absorbent pad was used to clean the tote after processing.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to cap closure within box leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting box in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA.

item.title: Report X-2023120873
item.description:
Report X-2023120873

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120873 SequenceEvent: Upon unloading of box it was found wet and leaking. It was placed in a tote and plastic bag to mitigate further leaking. Tote was then taken to the hazmat area for further investigation. DescribePack: Loose Cap on bottle and box was soaked and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking box and its contents were placed in a plastic bag and then a tote to stop any further leaking. 2. X-2023120878 SequenceEvent: Upon unloading of the package it was discovered that the package was wet and leaking. It was placed in a plastic bag and then a tote to mitigate further leaking and taken to hazmat area for further investigation. DescribePack: Closures on bottle failed and causing leaking and box to get wet and tear. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic bag and then inside a tote to mitigate any further leakage.
